com.esri.mo2.src.sys
Class BaseContent

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.src.sys.BaseContent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable, Content, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseFolder, InvalidContent
public abstract class BaseContent
extends Object
implements Content

this class provides support for the Comparable interface, by providing a compareTo() implementation that uses the Content's name as comparator value. The getProperties() method is also supported by providing an empty Properties object - subclasses can use this.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

BaseContent

public BaseContent()
Method Detail

createConnection

public Connection createConnection()
this implementation traverses the parent tree of this Content, to find the first parent Folder that returns a non-null Connection via constructConnection(). In this way, a Source can simply implement constructConnection in the root Folder of its Content tree, and all sub-Content will inherit automatically. A Source can also over-ride constructConnection within a Content to avoid the parent Folder traversal.

If this Content has no parent, then null is returned by default.

Specified by:
createConnection in interface Content
Returns:
the Connection class name constructed by root parent Folder, or null if this Content has no Connection
See Also:
constructConnection()

constructConnection

protected Connection constructConnection()
this helper method assists the parent Folder traversal performed by createConnection. The method implementation for this class returns a default null value. A Source will normally construct a special subclass of BaseContent that represents a root folder - that subclass would normally over-ride this method to produce a valid Connection object for the given Source. Thus the createConnection method simply searches up the Folder hierarchy until it finds a Folder that produces a non-null value from constructConnection.

Returns:
the relevant Connection, or null if createConnection should search in the parent.
See Also:
createConnection()

obtain the containing Folder. A "root" Folder has no parent.

getPath

public String getPath()
builds path name by traversing the Folder tree starting with this BaseContent and visiting each parent in turn, until an ancestor is found that either has null parent, or returns null for createConnection, or returns a different Connection type for createConnection

Specified by:
getPath in interface Content
Returns:
path to the content as string
See Also:
Source

compareTo

public int compareTo(Object o)
this method provides an implementation of java.lang.Comparable. The result of this method is determined by comparing the path of this with the path of o. The comparison is done case-independently for compatibility with Windows.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface Comparable
Parameters:
o - the object to be compared
Returns:
the value 0 if o is a Content that has the same path as this; a value less than 0 if the path of this BaseContent is lexicographically less than the path of o; and a value greater than 0 if the path of this BaseContent is lexicographically greater than the path of o.
Throws:
ClassCastException - if o is not a type of Content.
NullPointerException - if either this or o has a null path.

equals

public boolean equals(Object o)
compares the path of this with the path of param o by checking if the value of compareTo(o) == 0.

Overrides:
equals in class Object
Parameters:
o - the object to be compared for equality
Returns:
true == the paths are equal (case-independently), false == otherwise
See Also:
compareTo(java.lang.Object)

findContentType

searches for the given type among the available content types, using the strategy outlined in the Content interface

Returns:
